about.description: Starting from Airflow version 2.7.0 OpenLineage integration is included in Airflow repository as a provider. The apache-airflow-providers-openlineage package significantly ease lineage tracking in Airflow, ensuring stability by embedding the functionality directly into each provider and simplifying the process for users to select and manage lineage collection consumers.As a result, starting from Airflow 2.7.0 one should use the native Airflow Openlineage provider package.

Starting from Airflow version 2.7.0 OpenLineage integration is included in Airflow repository as a provider. The apache-airflow-providers-openlineage package significantly ease lineage tracking in Airflow, ensuring stability by embedding the functionality directly into each provider and simplifying the process for users to select and manage lineage collection consumers.As a result, starting from Airflow 2.7.0 one should use the native Airflow Openlineage provider package.

name: openlineage-airflow
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "openlineage-airflow" %}
{% set version = "1.7.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7547d6422ed6b97c4f699081bb1c88957e911d2969d4b6d0153625faa944e6aa

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.8
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.8
    - attrs >=20.3
    - requests >=2.20.0
    - openlineage-integration-common =={{ version }}
    - openlineage-python =={{ version }}
  run_constrained:
    - apache-airflow >=2.3

test:
  imports:
    - openlineage.airflow
    - openlineage.airflow.extractors
    - openlineage.lineage_backend
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip
    - apache-airflow >=2.3

about:
  summary: OpenLineage integration with Airflow
  home: https://github.com/OpenLineage/OpenLineage
  description: "Starting from Airflow version 2.7.0 OpenLineage integration is included in Airflow repository as a provider. The apache-airflow-providers-openlineage package significantly ease lineage tracking in Airflow, ensuring stability by embedding the functionality directly into each provider and simplifying the process for users to select and manage lineage collection consumers.As a result, starting from Airflow 2.7.0 one should use the native Airflow Openlineage provider package."
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: Apache
  license_file: LICENSE
  doc_url: https://openlineage.io/docs/integrations/airflow/
  dev_url: https://github.com/OpenLineage/OpenLineage/tree/main/integration/airflow

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - rxm7706
    - millsks
